newsitem.title: SPAIN: ETA Basque rebels claim two of six recent killings.
newsitem.headline: ETA Basque rebels claim two of six recent killings.

text.p: Basque separatist guerrilla group ETA claimed responsibility on Thursday for the first two of six killings this year in Spain.

Using its usual mouthpiece, radical Basque newspaper Egin, ETA (Basque Homeland and Freedom) said in a statement that the group had killed a bicycle vendor, shot in the head on January 30, because he had informed police of the whereabouts of a suspected activist who was later arrested.
ETA also killed an army officer in Madrid on Janurary 8 and planted a bomb under the car of national policeman in Bilbao, in a failed attack, the statement said.

The guerrillas have killed some 800 people since starting a drive independence in 1968. They usually target members of security forces, but also use violence as revenge or to extort money to support their cause.
